title: The dovvnefall of poperie proposed by way of a new challenge to all English Iesuits and Iesuited or Italianized papists: daring them all iointly, and euery one of them seuerally, to make answere thereunto if they can, or haue any truth on their side; knowing for a truth that otherwise all the world will crie with open mouths, fie vpon them, and their patched hotch-potch religion.
author: Bell, Thomas, fl. 1593-1610.
publisher: Printed by A[dam] Islip for Arthur Iohnson: and are to be sold at the signe of the White Horse, ouer against the great North doore of Paules,
notes: Running title reads: T. Bels challenge to the papist.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
